LabelText: Describe the signs of web application compromise (defacement, unexpected responses, alerts)
Identify affected application components (login, API endpoints, admin panels)
Place application behind maintenance or read-only mode if necessary
Collect web server logs, WAF logs, and application logs for the affected period
Identify the likely attack vector (SQLi, XSS, RCE, authentication bypass)
Validate integrity of web application files, containers, and deployed artifacts
Rotate credentials, API keys, and secrets used by the application
Patch vulnerabilities or misconfigurations exploited in the compromise
Monitor post-remediation traffic for ongoing exploitation attempts
